text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I'm
gonna show you how to make my shrimp in
crazy water in Italian it's called aqua
pasta which just means crazy water which
is just really is flavorful spicy broth
it's very simple to do perfect for
Christmas Eve especially if you're an
Italian an Italian household you know we
go crazy over seafood on Christmas even
this is a great recipe for it so let me
take you already ingredients so we can
get started you're going to need some
finely sliced fennel shallots garlic
parsley hot pepper flakes some white
wine water chopped tomatoes salt and
pepper olive oil and of course some
shrimp and I'm just using some large
shrimp that have been deveined but the
shell are still on them and that's my
mother would never cook shrimp without
the shell on them because she says that
it gives a lot of flavor which it does
so I'm leaving them on because that's
what she says and that's what I do so
what I have here is a large pot with a
few tablespoons of olive oil been
preheating over about medium heat we're
gonna add in my fennel along with my
shallot and garlic get that out of there
and I have pepper flakes for heat and a
little bit of the parsley not all of it
maybe about half give that a good stir
I'm gonna season them with some salt and
pepper and I'm gonna let them cook
slowly or about medium heat for about 10
minutes or until the veggies have
softened and cooked down a bit and I'll
show you what they look like when
they're there the veggies are looking
good and smelling even better add in my
wine if you don't want to use wine you
don't have to you can add in just a
little bit more water but wine does give
it just such fantastic flavor it's just
I can't I can't leave it out it's gonna
cook it for 30 seconds just to cook the
alcohol out just a little bit and then
we can add in a couple more ingredients
add in my crushed tomatoes that a stir
and my water because I don't want this
to be a thick sauce I want to be a
little on the thin side
now I'm gonna bring this to a boil let
it cook for about ten minutes and I will
show you what it looks like once it's
there and we'll finally and get ready to
add the shrimp my broth has been cooking
for about ten minutes it's time to
season it with some salt and pepper of
course it's super important and now
we're going to add in the shrimp -
shrimp
it's a stir dunk I'm run in there you
want them to be covered in the sauce I'm
gonna cover this with a lid and let them
cook for about five minutes or until
they turn a really nice bright pink
color then turn it off and I'll show you
what it looks like once it's done my
shrimp are fully cooked and add in my
parsley for a nice freshness and color
that smells so good I've got some bread
grilled here
grilled out on my little bruschetta pan
so that it's ready I'm gonna serve
myself just a little bit right now to
give us a taste I'm gonna go in with a
bread cuz this is how you do it
you got a soap it o up I'm going for
that juice that broth oh my my the
shrimp is delicious don't get me wrong
but that broth is where its app you need
tons of Italian crunchy bread grilled to
perfection then get a big bowl of it and
just dunk your life into it because that
is what's all about that's the best part
oh so good and you could add clams to
this and their clams mussels scallops
you can add like fake peas pieces of
fish and it'd be delicious
well I hope you guys have enjoyed
spending time with me I'm gonna go stuff
my face I'm gonna be honest if you want
to get this recipe go to
laurainthekitchen.com I hope you guys
have enjoyed spending time with me I'll
see you
bye-bye
